page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES OF CAPEL
page.content: THIS AREA COMPRISES PART OF THE PARISH OF CAPEL AND OUTSKIRTS OF TONBRIDGE. IT IS A PICTURESQUE RURAL REGION OF {FARMLAND, WOODLAND AND PARKLAND,}VERY SPARSELY POPULATED. THE RICH, HEAVY SOIL IS IDEAL FOR THE CULTIVATION OF {HOPS, CORN AND FRUIT}AND IS PART OF THE BLOSSOM TOUR. THE FLAT NORTHERN SECTION STRETCHES TO THE MEDWAY AND IS CROSSED BY THE RAILWAY LINE FROM TONBRIDGE TO PADDOCK WOOD. IT INCLUDES THE{MANOR OF SOMERHILL}AND VILLAGE OF TUDELEY.{ALL SAINTS CHURCH}IS WORLD RENOWNED SINCE THE INSTALLATION OF EIGHT FINE{STAINED GLASS WINDOWS BY {THE LATE MARC CHAGALL.}THE SOUTHERN SECTION RISES ON SANDSTONE FROM THE PRIMARY SCHOOL TO{THOMAS A BECKET {CHURCH,}WELL KNOWN FOR ITS WELL PRESERVED{WALL PAINTINGS.}THE MOST SOUTHERLY SECTION IS MAINLY WOODLAND WHERE SWEET CHESTNUTS ARE COPPICED.
